answers.c: open circuit and short circuit voltage
answers.d: . neither open circuit nor short circuit voltage

explanations.a: The Thevenin voltage (also called Thevenin equivalent voltage) is defined as the open-circuit voltage at the terminals of a linear two-terminal circuit when no load is connected. This means it's the voltage measured across the output terminals with infinite impedance (open circuit).

answers.c: shorting all voltage sources and opening all current sources
answers.d: opening all voltage sources and shorting all current sources

explanations.c: Because turning off sources (shorting voltage sources and opening current sources) reveals the circuit's internal resistance seen from the output terminals.
